content:
Diagnosis
	1. Prostate adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+3 (Grade Group 3)
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not indicated

	Radiotherapy
	12 Feb 2024 - 26 Mar 2024
	Radical IMRT 74Gy in 37 fractions to prostate and seminal vesicles with 60Gy to pelvic nodes

	Hormonal therapy
	Leuprorelin 3-monthly depot commenced 15 Jan 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Responding to treatment

	Current issues
	Hot flushes and fatigue

	Summary of consultation
	Case discussed at Uro-oncology MDT today. Initial PSA 42.1 ng/mL in January 2024. MRI showed T3b disease with right seminal vesicle invasion and suspicious right external iliac nodes. Bone scan negative. Patient completed radical radiotherapy 2 weeks ago with good tolerance. Latest PSA 0.8 ng/mL showing good biochemical response.

MDT recommendations:
1. Continue androgen deprivation therapy for total of 24 months
2. PSA monitoring every 3 months
3. Consider calcium/vitamin D supplementation given duration of planned ADT

Examination today shows good performance status. Digital rectal examination reveals reduction in prostatic induration compared to diagnosis.

	Further investigations
	PSA monitoring as above

	Medication prescribed
	Calcium/Vitamin D supplements initiated

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 months with PSA check one week prior

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function and bone profile in view of ongoing ADT
